text: - My name is Dan Rod.

I am the Senior Vice President
of Marketing for ASAP,
a generative AI leader in the CX space.

So gen AI is impacting our
industry pretty dramatically
in that it's giving us opportunities

to start automating customer
service interactions

that were previously not
able to be automated.
So it means a potential reduction
in the overall human capital with agents

and the ability to really
accelerate this idea
of abbreviating customer pain.

How do we shorten customer
pain by resolving these issues

that they have more
dramatically and much faster?
So there are a lot of misconceptions
that we all have about generative AI.

I think the biggest one, for
me at least, is in the idea

that generative AI automatically
makes things better versus
what I try to tell customers
is that it simply makes things different.

And because it's a tool,
whether it's a hammer
or generative AI, it's only valuable

if it solves more
problems than it creates.

So evaluating generative AI,
not just as simply as a thing
that makes things better, but understand

what makes things different,
and what those trade-offs are
is sometimes a misconception.
So when we think about security

and balancing security with
the promise of generative AI,

because we sell into
large enterprises in B2B,

it's a non-starter if
you have a novel solution

for generative AI, but you
can't fulfill the promise
of deep security in terms
of protecting not only customer data,
but also the knowledge management systems
that we access internally
to provide better customer support.

So for us, it's not only a
balance, it's a predicate

to any sort of generative
AI solution for many

of our customers in the
enterprise is our ability

to keep them secure and
keep them resilient.
AWS supports us in so many ways.

The biggest for us is that
it creates an environment
of resiliency and scalability that, again,

is a precursor for us to be
imaginative in the solutions
that we're giving to our customers.

So that platform in which
that we can build in safety

and in a trustworthy environment
is everything when it comes
to building solutions on AWS.
AWS helps ASAP to be more imaginative,

to be able to risk more in the
solutions that we're giving

to our customers because we
can trust the infrastructure
that we're built on.
(upbeat music)
